items.preText:
A slip welcomes Ross Taylor

Samin: "Should I give up hope?"

Dave: "After much has been said about the 'slow' start to this innings, we look to be on track for close to 300. I much prefer this to the 'swing and hope' from ball one we tried against India." This one is an easier chase too and not as strong a bowling attack
items.text: nicely flighted outside off, Taylor leans forward and blocks
items.postText: Rj SAAD: "Mohammad Saifuddin was looking too composed in BPL with his Yorkers, slow balls and length balls. But, today too ordinary!! Seen that for too many bowlers of the world. "

items.text: punches it off the front foot into the covers
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Guptill, no run

items.text: strange appeal for lbw as Guptill flicks that inswinging full delivery from middle stump for a single. The bat might have hit the pad or the ball might have deflected off the pad
angling in sharply, helped to square leg to get off the mark
right in the block hole this time and Guptill digs it out
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Guptill, no run

items.text: pulls the length back this time and Guptill drives it down to long-on
angling in towards the batsman, worked away towards deep midwicket
items.postText: Some of those incoming deliveries from Saifuddin looked pretty sharp and accurate

items.text: drives that ball into the covers in the gap and gets one
leans forward and uses soft hands to push the ball around cover point and steals a quick single
on leg stump, clipped towards long-on easily
turning in and too close to cut, but Taylor tries and gets an edge onto his pads
flatter and quicker outside off on length, he defends it back
flighted on a teasing length outside off, he waits and the ball turns to take a thick inside edge to go to leg

items.preText: Time for a change - here's Mustafizur. There's a gully in place, no midwicket
items.text: pitched up on off stump and Guptill makes that look so easy by driving that nicely with a straight bat, straight down the ground over Taylor's head for four
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Guptill, FOUR runs

items.text: a slower cutter at 123kmh but well outside leg, worked away to leg for one and the team 150 comes up
a slow cutter outside off on length, Taylor waits and pushes it down to mid-off
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Taylor, no run

items.text: on the pads again and Taylor helps it between mid-on and midwicket for one
bangs it in much shorter outside off, Guptill guides it behind square on off by keeping it down
bit of hesitation initially but they complete the run easily after Taylor defends the 138kmh delivery on middle and leg to the leg side
nicely flighted outside off, he pushes it back to the bowler
little wider on off and he drives it into the covers for one
leans forward a bit and blocks the length delivery
cross-seamed delivery on length, and it's worked towards long-on
very slow and wide outside off, cuts it off the bak foot for one
turning in a bit and he defends it back carefully
items.postText:
Thanks, Vishal.

That's the last drinks break of the match and Varun is back to see you till the end Abhilash Munshi: "The ease with which nz are chasing this down.. shows the quality of the Indian attack the faced in the last series..."
